alert.note: Alert for Carter; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Lawrence and southern Carter Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grayson to near Gates. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Olive Hill, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Webbville, Denton, Houckville, Grahn, Soldier, Globe, Fallsburg, Willard, and Hitchins. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky near mile marker 149, and between mile markers 160 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
